Suspicious modification or replacement o.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 4656
Suspicious modification or replacement o.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 4663 and 4656 for write/modify operations on critical application binaries/data files. Establish baseline file hashes or expected file sizes/timestamps for these critical files. Alert on or investigate deviations (e.g., correlation of file modification events with unexpected hashes or changes outside of patching/maintenance windows).

Unusual process execution interacting wi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation events. Identify processes interacting with known critical data files or binaries (based on command line or parent process). Use descriptive statistics to identify rare process names, unusual command line arguments, or processes running from atypical directories interacting with these critical resources. Apply correlation analysis to link suspicious process activity with file modification events.
